intro: Polycarena maxii, commonly known as the Madagascar star grass, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
